content: 1 turn after working row 1-4 once repeat row 3-4 until all stitches are worked you will end on a wrong side row you now have 18 20 20 22 stitches remaining proceed to gusset pick up gusset pick up knit 9 10 10 11 stitches place marker this will now be the beginning of the round knit 9 10 10 11 stitches pick up and knit 14 16 17 18 stitches along the edge of the heel flap pick up an extra stitch in the corner to close the gap knit across 28 32 34 36 instep stitches pick up an extra stitch in the corner then pick up and knit 14 16 17 18 stitches along edge of the heel flap knit to beginning of round marker proceed to gusset decreases gusset decreases repeat rounds 1 & 2 as follows round 1 knit to 3 stitches before the instep k2tog knit 1 knit across instep stitches knit 1 ssk knit to beginning of round marker round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 & 2 until you are back down to 56 64 68 72 total stitches note once you have completed the gusset the beginning of round will now be back to the original location proceed to foot foot of sock continue knitting all stitches until your sock measures 2 inches short of your desired foot length proceed to knit your choice of toe wedge toe round 1 knit 1 ssk knit to last three stitches of instep k2tog knit 1 knit 1 ssk knit to last three stitches of foot k2tog knit 1 round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 & 2 ending on round 2 until you have 24 28 28 28 stitches 12 14 14 14 on instep and sole graft toe closed with kitchener stitch rounded toe round 1 knit 1 ssk knit to last three stitches of instep k2tog knit 1 knit 1 ssk knit to last three stitches of foot k2tog knit 1 round 2 knit all stitches repeat repeat rounds 1&2 until 28 32 32 36 stitches remain 14 16 16 18 stitches on instep and sole now repeat row 1 until 16 16 16 16 stitches remain 8 8 8 8 stitches on instep and sole graft toe closed with kitchener stitch finishing socks you have now completed your sock repeat process for a second sock weave in the ends and soak the socks in warm water and wool soap press out excess water to dry now all you need to do is enjoy the socks i hope you have enjoyed using this pattern as much as i enjoyed writing it if you have any questions comments or suggestions please feel free to contact me instagram two_stix ravelry two-stix
